Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, friendly staff that makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: Ronit M
Reviews.Content: I took a single room so it was kind of small but specious enough for my luggage. The bathroom had only a small shower. Breakfast was good with variety to things. The staff was friendly and very helpful in getting along in Paris, even looked for addresses in the internet for me. Location-wise, there’s a near Metro station so you can a get anywhere vey easy and there are restaurants on the main street near the hotel. The only problem I had was on the first night, the hotel is located in a small alley, on the first night just after my arrival I went to look for something to eat and didn’t find the hotel on the way back… fortunately I met dome friendly Parisians that wanted to help me despite not speaking English. At the end they just called the hotel and told them where we’re at, the person at the front desk instruct me on hoe to find the hotel…. Internet is free in the lobby, I got a room on the first flour at managed to pick up the free Wi-Fi. I believe the service of the staff makes the difference between this hotel and any other budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable room and quiet environment”
Reviews.Author: glasgowjing
Reviews.Content: clean and comfortable room; good size of the room; really kind and helpful services provided from the staff. Price is reasonable. Around 10 mins walk from the subway station, but the environment is really good. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: julie a
Reviews.Content: 2nd trip to Paris and stayed here both times. The perfect place for B&B, easy access into Paris city centre, staff very friendly and rooms kept very clean. If we go back 3rd time here is where .we will stay

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels out there for the price”
Reviews.Author: elsierose1107
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family reunion. On arrival, we were kept waiting at Reception whilst the receptionist sorted out our keys for three rooms for 3 nights. For some reason, this took a long time! My fiancé and I were eventually allocated a room on the ground floor; it would seem we drew a short straw here as our room smelt like a drain and was quite small, even for a Parisien hotel. It was a disabled access room, so the shower room was enormous...puzzlingly, the door wasn't very wide nor did it seem to open far enough to accommodate a wheelchair. Curious, like the smell. There's no air-con but the windows opened (onto the terrace) but our room stayed quite cool. Our room was reasonably clean; however, upstairs in my sister's room it was a different story as she discovered some white crusty stains on the carpet and coverlet. The breakfast was disappointing - very basic continental (packet ham, cheese, yoghurt, coffee, croissant) offering with the cheapest brands of everything and it all ran out very quickly & wasn't replaced with any alarcity. We enjoyed pretty good nights' sleep despite being on the ground floor. My poor aged father did not as on the second night his neighbour's door had to be taken down, and the receptionist was incredibly unhelpful when he reported this. "It's not our fault". The hotel is about a 15 min walk from Denfert or Glaciére; there are a couple of nice brasseries on the Boulevard Arago and it's handy for town. I wouldn't say it is central or nice enough to command its price tag with the Euro/GBP being what it is at the mo'; you would find a better deal closer to town, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SteveNM
Reviews.Content: Arrived 5/26/2011 from Baltimore via London to CDG Airport. It was pretty easy getting into Paris. The passport review was quick and simple – they also speak English. At the terminal I was able to locate the signs for the RER B train into town. This is one of several options for getting into the city. For me it was economical, easy, and had a metro stop close to my hotel. There are plenty of signs that lead you to RER B – follow the signs and you will eventually get to the ticket seller. They also speak English. Get the roundtrip RER ticket (good for use at any time) if you plan to come back to this airport. The ticket will also get you through the metro if you need to use both – I did. I also bought a “book” of 10 metro tickets. I like to walk, but it is always handy to have metro access, especially when you’ve been doing too much walking for a day. All transactions went very smoothly using major credit card. I went to the #12 platform and the train was already there waiting. In less than a couple of minutes I was headed into town (I had two pieces of luggage – one large enough to stow in overhead, and a small backpack) – since I arrived during a busy time, it was kind of awkward maneuvering the luggage to keep it out of the way as people got on and off – mind you the train got packed, and this was about 6:30-7:30 pm, so be forewarned especially if you have lots of baggage. The 1st transfer stop went smoothly. I had to maneuver luggage using stairs, so be aware. Metro entrance was easy to find, using RER ticket I went through no problem and found appropriate car. I used Google maps to get directions from the metro stop to the hotel. When I arrived at my stop (used stairs again), the map helped me find the hotel very easily. Getting there from the metro stop went without a hitch. There are three stops near this hotel – Gobelins, Glaciers, and Corvisart. I found the Gobelins closest and easiest. Arrived at hotel and was greeted by friendly staff. I used a major credit card (after having reserved on line), and had no problems. I was given key to my room and went up to call it a night. The room is a single room with a bathroom. I have a single bed, a large storage space with cubbyholes and hanging closet and a fold out for my luggage – lots of storage. The bathroom was clean and just big enough. Although there is no air conditioning, I opened the window and the room cooled down right away. The days got hotter as time went by, but did not need a fan so far – especially at night. Breakfast is included in the cost of the hotel for Saturday and Sunday stays only. If you want it during the week, the cost is extra. I would recommend getting the breakfast. There are a variety of drinks including juices, coffee, tea, milk, hot water, etc. You have croissants, bread (for toasting if you like), baguette (cheese and ham were available to make sandwich), jams, jelly, butter, etc.; variety of cereals; fruit cocktail and peach compote and applesauce and yogurt were also available. So it is pretty substantial. The best part is that you have access to wifi on the ground floor, and you can have breakfast and catch up on e-mail and surf while having that 2nd or 3rd cup of coffee in the dining room or on the patio. It’s all you can eat, so it prepares you for the long day ahead of sightseeing, etc. Although wifi is available only on the ground floor, you can occasionally access it in your room (I was in 411), during off hours or when you get lucky. If you have problems, the staff is very helpful with getting you up and running. The staff varies throughout the day, and from day to day. All speak English and are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are turned over each day. The hotel has some wear and it shows on carpets, rugs, bedding, etc., but nothing to be alarmed about. It is quite comfortable. A bigger pillow would have been nice. The room is quiet but can be kind of noisy during the night – especially on weekends. My window faced the street entrance. If you close the window, it drowns out the noise some, but if this is something that affects your sleep, I would highly recommend earplugs. There is a TV in the room and a telephone (never used but wake up service is available). If you’re coming from US, be sure to bring an electrical adapter. My room only had one outlet near my bed, so not a problem. I was able to recharge my laptop, camera batteries, etc., with no problems. There is an outlet in the bathroom for a hair dryer you can get from the hotel. Bring your own alarm clock too if you need one. There is an ironing room on the 6th floor, too. There are lots of facilities within walking distance: small markets, convenience stores, laundry, dry cleaning, and lots of places to get drinks, snacks and meals. A convenient market, bakery, and butcher (with roasted chicken and cold cuts) are just around the corner. Metro stops are very close and easy to use to get to major attractions. I like to walk a lot, so I used Google maps to get directions for walking to and from places no matter how close or far. I have an old Michelin Paris Plan (#11) that I bought for my trip here about 20 years ago. It is still accurate, and I used it quite a bit especially when I thought I was getting lost. Some kind of map is a must. The metro stations also provide Metro maps as well – learn how to use the system, it really is a timesaver. Really enjoyed my stay here and that was mostly due to the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: perbinder
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a conference. Nice, clean room with shower and bath. Comfortable bed. Warm room in the cold weather. Slightly outside the centre of town but only 10 mins walk to metro. Nice and cheap hotel. Brilliant receptionist, he was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Satans7thBride
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here. Our room was basic, two single beds and a small bathroom. It was pretty decent, very clean, and the staff speak english and are very helpful and friendly. Its located in a very quiet neighborhood and is just a short walk from the metro. The only complaint I have is that there's no A/C, which is an absolute killer in summer. I would avoid this hotel during hotter months! But apart from that, this is a good hotel for the price. I would stay here again, just not in July lol.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, really basic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jennyrob669
Reviews.Content: Like most of the previous reviews the hotel is in a good location. The metro is only 300m away so getting into the heart of Paris is no problem. There is a hospital, couple of bars and cake shops close by, but not much else. The room was tiny. I personally didn't get much sleep because the walls seem to be paper thin. You can hear everything people are doing, watching TV, using the bathroom, getting home late. It's such a noisy hotel! The breakfast was basic, just fruit, or croissants. A choice of coffee or orage juice to drink. One day the drinks machines broke down (both of them), but the staff weren't to bothered, so no drinks for anyone. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful I have to say, but they need to put more than one staff member on the desk at one time. There was always a que for reception. There is free wifi for half an hour a day.

Reviews.Title: “No frills - Basic & Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sinkid
Reviews.Content: Writing this review because of a commendable counter staff - her name is Vanessa. She is soft-spoken and exceptionally helpful, she never fail to greet you with a simple smile and often provide spot-on details on getting you to the right location (5-Stars Service for this young & enthusiastic lady) This is a basic and no-frills hotel. IMO, the room is ok, nothing fanciful but a plus for traveler with tight budget. 2 Metro (Covisart & Les Gobelins) is about 10-15 min away on foot to get you around Paris easily. Hotel located in a quiet residential estate with decent cafes, bakery and small food shops, you can get more food varieties if you walk abit further to Place d'Italie where Metro Gobelins is located. Interesting, you'll get to pass by school along the way to Covisart and experience the local kids way of life in the morning and evening. Happen to bump into a street-market (make shift store selling groceries and local food on Saturday during my stay near Covisart. Overall, the walk around this area is easy and safe after some map orientation.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here - most unpleasant hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: ArmandoJose
Reviews.Content: My first thought was "you have to be kidding me". The staff was particularly unhelpful, nothing at the hotel was like the photos on Expedia, the rooms tiny, filthy and poorly equipped, in desparate need not so much of a deep cleaning but of replacement, the amenities virtually non-existent (and TVs that barely show a handful of channels) and the location is inconvenient. We spent the most unpleasant night ever and checked the next morning into another hotel. WE MADE RESERVATIONS HERE IN RELIANCE OF THE IMAGES SHOWN AND THE NAME APARTHOTEL BUT THIS PROPERTY HAS NO SUCH THING AS APARTMENTS and the staff very rudely suggested that if we wanted that kind of service we should have checked into a "better" hotel. Stay here if you like to suffer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel in convenient Paris location - good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFamilyBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days while at a meeting. The rooms were small but clean and the fixtures and furniture are quire new. The desk staff was friendly and there were no problems with my pre-paid online booking (I have had trouble with this at other Paris hotels). The location is quiet and convenient to 3 Metro stops. I walked to my meeting (near Odeon Metro) each day and enjoyed visiting different neighborhoods on the way. The nearby Gobelins square has quite a few restaurants, which are not fancy but being out of the main tourist area are a good value. My only real complaint is that the wireless internet was quite expensive and did not work at all on the 5th floor. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: steve-h132
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with several days on a business trip. It is inexpensive in a boring arrondisment. The desk staff was okay. Like most french hotels, if you treated them with lots of respect and tried french you got good (not great service). If you started complaining or wanted anything, tough... There was some confusion on the bill, they charged both me and the sponsor for the same room. Also internet access was supposed to be included, per original contract, but they charged extra for it. Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive (for Paris) hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl_41448
Reviews.Content: This is a good, basic, inexpensive little hotel which was recommended to me by a French friend who lives nearby whose out- of- town family stay here when they visit. We stayed here for 5 nights in mid-September and once again in mid-Oct. as we were departing. We paid between 76 and 80 Euros per night, depending on the day of the week and how we booked it. Be sure breakfast is included when you book--sometimes it is and sometimes it isn't. Look for a deal that includes it. Book well ahead as this hotel fills up fast. The rooms were plain and simple, but clean. A helpful staff member was always at the front desk to answer questions. We arrived at about 7 a.m. after having been on the airplane or in airports most of the day and night before our arrival. Even though check-in wasn't until 3 p.m., the desk clerk asked the housekeeper to clean a room for us and let us have it early. It was tucked away on the first floor and was extremely quiet as was the other room we had on a floor higher up. There are several metro stations nearby (Corvisart, Glaciere, and Gobelins) as well as a bus stop which will take you directly to a couple of the train stations -- much easier than lugging suitcases in the metro. The best part about this location is that it is near the Rue Moufletard--a shopping street full of small food shops and restaurants where our friends Marisa and Dominique do their grocery shopping. Meander down it to get to the Latin Quarter. The route will take you by the Pantheon and other old churches that merit exploring. One of my favorite finds on the Rue Moufletard was the "Maison des Tartes"--a little fixed price restaurant which features different types of quiches. For just 8 Euros, we had a fabulous quiche and salad. My memory may be failing me, but I think a glass of wine was also included in the prix-fixe menu.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little Hotel, Nothing Fancy but Great Value”
Reviews.Author: waltfp3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris, we stayed here for 5 nights. We were in room 501, on the 5th floor. The place is very clean, no smells or anything. The hotel is about 4 blocks from Metro stop Corvisart on the Green 6 line which has direct connections to the Eiffel Tower, the Arc d' triomphe, and not far from everything else with usually only one connection. There is a very nice bakery nearby on Rue Corvisart and a couple of schools nearby too (my mother was fascinated by just listening to the kids chatter in the mornings on our way to the metro. They offer you a vending machine in the lobby for drinks and small snacks, and a breakfast buffet which we never used because we always chose to eat at the local bakery. The front desk was great, booked us 3 taxi rides during our stay and we had no issues. It's not the ritz folks, but for the price we were pleasantly surprised. The beds were made everyday, and although the rooms were small, they fit our needs (me, 25, and my 50 yo mother). It's about 50-70 euro to CDG airport but you can take the train as well if you're brave enough to haul your luggage up and down the metro stairs. They have a room on the 6th, the top, floor for ironing you're clothes if need be, there are no irons in the room. If you're on a budget, this place is a steal, great service, good rooms, and a nice quiet neighborhood (we never heard any police sirens which were so prevalent in almost every other place we visited.) Give this place a chance, it won't dissappoint!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy nights”
Reviews.Author: Dikbidik
Reviews.Content: It's the noisiest hotel I've ever stayed at. It seems to attract a rather boisterous clientele. During the 5 nights I stayed there, I was invariably woken up between 2 and 5am by loud talking, laughing, singing. One morning at 5 am, I heard disturbing screams and then the sound of people running up and down the hallway. When I called the hotel in advance to check if they had air conditioning, they lied and told me they did. Deceitful! Anyway, this means that you can't even close the windows to keep the noise out. I had read pretty positive reviews of the hotel on this site. After staying there I really wonder who wrote them!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: audiophi1e
Reviews.Content: Location: It is near to a major boulevard with a decent amount of cafes on it. It is also near to 2 metro stops, one of which goes directly to the Louvre. It's about a 5 minute walk to either station. Neither walk at night is dangerous, since either way is well lit. Service: The only time we needed to make use of the hotel staff was in settling a difficulty with our reservation. We booked via Expedia, but with 2 separate reservations because the first one was with our air miles, and the 2nd one was paid, also booked via expedia. We mistakenly booked our 2nd reservation for the wrong day, and one concierge made it his business to make it as difficult as it could be for us. Attempted to charge us for anything he could think of. Fortunately the manager is much more forgiving, and the matter was settled quickly afterward without extra charge. That one concierge was the only bad one, the others were all very pleasant and spoke English well. The maids came daily and did a good job cleaning our room and even figured out on their own that we like to keep the windows open during the day (to avoid any musty smells). they were also pleasant. Rooms: We stayed in Room 306. It was about 7x10ft, with a very small bathroom about 4x5ft. We expected it to be small so we were ok. The room had a 13" TV (that was suspended from the ceiling--saving precious floor space) that we never turned on so i can't comment on the quality of the picture or the channels they have. The room was clean, the carpet didn't have any stains on it, neither did the room smell. The room was simple, but appeared to be recently renovated with modern styling. The bed was decently firm, but felt mildly old (maybe 1-2yrs old?) because the center of the bed was concave. Still, it was supportive and i never had any difficulty having a good night sleep. It was roughly the size of an american full size. The bathroom was basic, with sink, toilet and shower stall. The water pressure was good, and the temperature was easy to control with no problems maintaining temperature. Make sure you bring outlet converters, because as expected, this hotel only had european plugs, 220v. It had 3 plugs, which was plenty for us. ***Be careful, for those of you staying during the summer, our room didn't have an A/C, neither do i think the other rooms. The weather was in the 70's, so heat wasn't an issue, but if it gets hot and humid...i'm not sure how it would be. Amenities: The room did not come with a hairdryer, iron or ironboard. I hear that some hotels you can ask for these at the desk. We didn't bother gambling on this and just brought our own things. Breakfast as served from 7-10am, and costs 7Euro per person. I never ate this so i can't comment. I heard that they serve crossaints and other breads, cheeses and juices. We ate from nearby Boulangeries instead, which also serve the same things, and was cheaper. There is a vending machine in the lobby in case you need something to snack on or drink in the middle of the night. Overall, this is a good value, for the price. it's not your romantic bed+breakfast or boutique hotel, it's not your ultra-posh hotel, nor does it pretend to be any of these. It's clean, is in a good location, and it's the right price. Just avoid that one mean guy (he looks like a really uptight guy in his late 30's) and you'll have a great time in Paris like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Break”
Reviews.Author: copey71
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day stay at Touring Hotel. Had a fantastic time!!! The hotel is very clean and all the staff spoke very good English and were very helpful. The room was basic but again very clean and clean towels were provided. The bed was made and the room was cleaned every day. The only criticism i have about the rooms is there are no tea/coffee making facilities and there are no English speaking channels on the TV. These are only small niggles and didn't spoil our stay. I would definately recommend this hotel for your stay in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Barfota
Reviews.Content: No charm, but clean and tidy. The interior is simple, funtional and well kept. It is a good hotel if you just want a place to sleep. The bathroom (shower, no tub) was small but clean with soft towels, soap and schampoo. The breakfast was no fun. Coffee, tea, baguette, croissant, juice, eggs to boil, plain yoghurt, tinned fruit sallad, jam and brie. I love brie, but not for breakfast. And I get unhappy when I get nothing but jam for the bread. I would like some slices of cheese or ham. The staff was very helpful and nice. Because of a strike the metro and the trains didn't run and the staff at the desk worked hard to help us getting to the airport in time. They also spoke excellent English. The hotel is situated in a rather quiet area in the south of Paris. Quite far from downtown, but the metro makes it easy to get to all the attractions. It is at a five to ten minutes walk to the metro station. There are several nice restaurants close to the metro station. You also reach rue Mouffetard (nice pedestrian street with cosy restaurants) and Place d'Italie (with a big shopping centre) by foot without problem.

Reviews.Title: “Harried Staff, BedBugs.... No Thanks”
Reviews.Author: goldkold
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of booking this hotel for a week after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and I wonder whether the other reviewers actually stayed in this same hotel!! First of all,some of the receptionists in this hotel are among the rudest I have ever encountered and they always seem to be harried. If you ask them to call a cab, they act as if they are doing you a favor. Again I say some and not all with the female staff slightly better than the male ones. The room was shockingly tiny even for Paris with hardly space to walk around and the bathroom was like a cell with my knees touching the door while sitting on the toilet seat. But the worst thing about this hotel has to be the bedbugs. I woke up the next morning with bites all over my body. My poor 2 year old nephew and one year old niece were the worst affecrted with bites over their faces too. Also, the metro is a long walk for Paris and the area in which the hotel is located leaves a lot to be desired. I really don't want to sound as if I'm nagging but it was a terrible experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in september”
Reviews.Author: Mark-Guilbert
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was reasonably priced. The rooms were sufficient by french standards and the location wasn't ideal or so we thought . . . The metro is close by and is extemely efficient and cheap, just avoid the rush times. This allows you to access all of Paris quickly and easily. We far preferred to walk and if you headed north from the hotel towards the student areas (Rue Mouffetard) there were a large number of restaurants at very reasonble prices. Mme Nadine at the hotel speakes excellent english and is very, very helpful. We stayed six nights and it was excellent value for money. Our big moan about Paris in General was the amount of dog poo evreywhere - just watch your step.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal In Paris”
Reviews.Author: Scourgey
Reviews.Content: At first I was worried about booking this hotel since there were no reviews, but after a 14 day stay in Paris, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. This is in conjunction with a conference. So I stayed at the Touring Magendie Hotel before and after my conference. The bottom line is this is like staying at a good quality Holiday Inn Express that has been renovated. Area: 13th Arrondistment near Les Goblins and Covisart Metro Stations. A very quiet authentic part of Paris. With very easy metro access to two different lines (7 and 4). Condition: Rooms a small but they are very well designed. Seems to be newly renovated, ask for rooms above the 1st and 2nd floor which are in almost new condition. Note-no air conditioning Guests: Mostly European tourists, some with families of two or three children and a few business travelers. Amenities: Breakfast is not included but for 6.80 Euros per day there is a decent continental breakfast with very good croissants (better than the ones at the Hilton Paris). TV with basic channels, phone, shampoo and soap. Concierge: Well the Manager Madame Nadine is usually there in the mornings and I found her to be very very helpful. Note: My shower was not being cleaned after two days and I tipped the cleaning staff and insisted that my shower is cleaned and the problem was corrected. Rely on Manager Madam Nadine's advice. For a coin laundry near the hotel: Take a left from the entrance, the take a left at the end of the street. Turn left onto Rue de Glacier and you will see a Lavanier Libre Service. As the front desk if you are not sure Wifi: Don't pay for the wifi at the hotel. If you are there during good weather. Walk on Rue de Covisart toward the Metro station of the same name. Along the way you will pass the Square Rene de Garre. Free Paris City Wifi is all around the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: thanner
Reviews.Content: There were 3 girls in this trip and we stayed at the Touring Hotel in late Feb. The hotel is easy to find, the directions given are hard to mess up. The hotel is small but comfortable, located on a quiet street just off a main street. The customer service was great, we had no problems. The rooms are small but I think that's too be expected. They are well maintained and very clean. We stayed at this hotel at two different times during our trip and both times were equally good and the rooms were identical. The location is a little further from the main attractions in Paris, but never more than a 10 min ride on the metro. The metro is very close to the hotel, about a 5-7 min walk. It is extremely accessible. Overall I would defintely recommend this to anyone looking for a clean and comfortable stay but affordable stay in Paris!

HotelInfo.Name: Belambra Clubs - Magendie
HotelInfo.Address: 2/4 rue Magendie (corner 6, rue Corvisart), 75013 Paris, France (Formerly Touring Hotel Magendie)
